|cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 |cpu1spd = 800 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Spansion;S34ML01G100TFI00; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = ESMT;M15F2G16128A-ADB; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 74:D0:2B |oui = 74:D0:2B |bootwait = |stockbootloader = CFE;1.0.1.9;; |stockos = Linux;2.6.36;brcmarm; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0, USB 3.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = supported |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 19 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.75 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 4-pin header |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = AiCloud support, AiMesh, |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Richwave;RTC6649E;;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5023L;SiGe, 5023L, TW;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = ASUS, ASUS_5G |defaultssid_regex = ^ASUS$,,, ^ASUS_5G$ |default_ch = |manuf = Askey |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = Asuswrt-Merlin, DD-WRT, FreshTomato-ARM, OpenWrt, Tomato (shibby), Tomato RAF (Victek), |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 09/30/2013 |estreldate = 10/09/2013 |estprice = 219.99 |upc = 886227419005 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = N82E16833320174 |asin = B00FB45SI4 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 220 mm x 160 mm x 83.3 mm |weight = 640 g |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1308 P20, 266562 3 W; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam1 = 600 |rad1n = 450 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = |rad1cap = |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1308 P20, 266562 3 W; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad2ac = 1300 |nqam2 = 600 |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 |rad2correv = |rad2cap = }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *Model Part Num: 90IG00C1-BM3000 {{WiFiCert|WFA19421|08/29/2013}} :This certification also applies to the ''RT-AC68R''. This device would seem to be running Linux kernel 2.6.36.4 (brcmarm). Note: A tag line of ''802.11ac Concurrent Dual-band AC1900 Router'' ''(600Mbps/2.4GHz*
+ 1300Mbps/5GHz)'' w/ [https://github.com/RMerl/asuswrt-merlin/blob/master/release/src/router/www/EN.dict ''ASUSWRT'' source] to the RT-AC68U, RT-AC68U v2, RT-AC69U. ===FCC info=== *The ''ASUS'' logo, "RT-AC68U" and "REV 1.60" is silkscreened on the board. *The manufacturer stated in the test report is ''[[Askey]] Technology (Jiangsu)'' Per the FCC photos... *The SoC used would seem to be BCM4708A0/BCM4709A0 :(BCM470[8/9]A0KFEBG, TT1311 P10, 272573-04 B18) :Visual inspection of actual product confirms ''BCM4708A'' *Two BCM4360 provide the wireless interfaces for this device. *The shown power supply is an ''ASUS'' branded AD890326 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.8A -> 19VDC, 1.75A). {{seealso|ASUS RT-AC68}} ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *''Inside Story: [[ASUS RT-AC56U]] & RT-AC68U'' [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-features/32120-inside-story-asus-rt-ac56u-and-rt-ac68u on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :Per ''SNB'''s conversation w/ [[Broadcom]], ''nqam'' functionality is integrated :into ''Broadcom'' 802.11ac chips - allowing ''QAM256'' usage in 2.4GHz band. *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32239-ac1900-first-look-netgear-r7000-a-asus-rt-ac68u ''AC1900 First Look: NETGEAR R7000 & ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''SNB'''] *[http://reviews.cnet.com/routers/asus-rt-ac68u-dual/4505-3319_7-35828165.html ''ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''C|Net'''] (Rev A1 unit, 74:D0:2B OUI) *[http://foxnetlab.com/index.php/16-reviews/92-the-new-wireless-flagship-device-or-asus-rt-ac68u ''The New Wireless Flagship Device or ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''FoxNetLab'''] *[https://openitforum.pl/index/recenzje/routery/asus/rt-ac68u/ ''ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''OpenITforum'''] ===Forum threads=== *[http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?30722-Asus-RT-AC56U-802-11ac-Gigabit-DualBand-Wireless-Router&p=258196#post258196 On '''wl500g'''] *[http://forum.ixbt.com/topic.cgi?id=14:58696-2#30 On '''IXBT'''] *[http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/internet-bandwidth-networking-clinic-4/%5Bupcoming%5D-asus-rt-ac67u-dual-band-wireless-ac1900-router-4116129.html On '''HardWareZone'''] :[http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/internet-bandwidth-networking-clinic-4/%5Bmaylyns-review%5D-asus-rt-ac66u-dark-knight-rises-3845510-50.html Image of the device on ''maylyn'''s AC66U review thread] ===Third party firmware support=== *[http://svn.dd-wrt.com/changeset/21018 Experimental '''DD-WRT''' support in SVN ''r21018''] ===Other=== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q-xghKyW_QI ''CES 2013 Day 0 - ASUS Networking Products'' on YouTube] (3:30) *[http://press.asus.com/asus-announces-next-generation-wi-fi-devices-and-new-portable-projector/ ''ASUS Announces Next-Generation Wi-Fi Devices'' - ''ASUS'' Press Release] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/31778-broadcom-announces-beefed-up-socs-to-power-up-draft-80211ac-products ''Broadcom Announces Beefed-Up SoCs To Power Up Draft 802.11ac
Products'' on SmallNetBuilder] (BCM4708x series announcement stuff) ====Additional vendor links==== [http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16833320174&Tpk=ASUS%20RT-AC68U/ On '''Newegg''' (preorder only)] (source of the release date and price) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRT |techdata = |wikipage = |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|broadcomwifi}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/asus/asus_rt-ac68u |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/asus/rt-ac68u |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=51005 |forumpage2 = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=52378 |forumpage3 = |github = |target = bcm53xx |subtarget = generic |arch = arm_cortex-a9 |support_started_version = 15.05 |current_supported_version = 23.05.0 |image_too_big = |unsupportedfuncntions = [https://openwrt.org/unsupported/wifi_2.4ghz_partly WiFi 2.4GHz partly], [https://openwrt.org/unsupported/wifi_5ghz WiFi 5GHz] |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ===Flashing Tomato=== Please insert instructions here ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' File:Asus RT-AC68U 001.jpg| File:Asus RT-AC68U 002.jpg| File:Asus RT-AC68U 003.jpg| File:Asus RT-AC68U 004.png|
[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]] ==Notes== ===Additional specifications=== :per ''ASUS'''s product page *''Expansion IFs:'' 1x USB 2.0, 1x USB 3.0 *''Dimensions (W x H x D):'' 220 mm x 160 mm x 83.3 mm *''Weight:'' 640 g ===T-Mobile Personal Cellspot Router (TM-AC1900)=== ====Support==== * [http://www.asus.com/supportonly/TM-AC1900/ Support page] for [[ASUS TM-AC1900]] * [https://support.t-mobile.com/community/coverage/personal-cellspot/wi-fi-cellspot-router T-Mobile Support page] *T-Mobile released a wireless router rebranded from the RT-AC68U. :The T-Mobile rebranded version has a custom proprietary firmware :that is modified for optimizing the T-Mobile Wi-Fi calling feature. :This router requires a refundable $25 deposit (or none if qualified) for postpaid :plan customers [$99 for retail pricing/prepaid accounts] since this is a lease. *''Notice'': If you got this router as a postpaid customer, keep in mind that T-Mobile expects :it back after you cancel your T-Mobile service or if a coverage line is disconnected :from a family/multiple line account within 45 days after cancellation/disconnection. :Failure to do so may incur a $99 non-return fee. If the router is returned damaged, $25. :[This doesn't apply to prepaid customers or if bought in retail price.] ==See also== *'''ASUS RT-AC68U''' • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68U/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68P]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68P/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68R]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68R/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68W]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68W/ Product Page] [[Category:English Documentation]]
